entry.title: Sunak makes it to one year as PM, but any celebrations in No 10 will be muted
entry.summary: A year has come to be a long and treacherous road in politics, as witnessed by the turbulence of late. But Rishi Sunak has survived his first as Prime Minister. Mr Sunak will have lasted more than seven times as long as Liz Trussâ€™s fleeting tenure when he marks his first anniversary in No 10 on Wednesday. But No 10 is eager to dispel suggestions that there will be celebrations of any kind as he faces entrenched unease among Tories, a stuttering economy and crises abroad. Mr Sunak may have steadied the ship after his predecessorâ€™s chaotic 49-day spell as prime minister, but he remains lagging a distant second behind Labour in the polls.

entry.title: 'Will not let world forget': Israel screens raw footage of Hamas brutal massacre

The footage, collected from various sources including body cameras, dashcams, and social media accounts, shows bloodied corpses, charred bodies, and brutalized individuals. The military aims to create a collective memory and ensure that the world does not forget the atrocities committed, which they describe as both a war crime and a crime against humanity.

entry.title: 'Went through hell': Freed hostage, 85, recalls being in 'spider web' of tunnels
entry.summary: Yocheved Lifshitz, an 85-year-old woman who was held hostage by Palestinian militants in Gaza, has described being beaten and taken through underground tunnels during her captivity. She is the first hostage to provide a public account of the conditions faced by the estimated 200 hostages held by Hamas and other armed groups in Gaza. Lifshitz was freed along with another woman, but their husbands remain in captivity. She recalled the horrors suffered by her neighbors during the attack on her town and stated that her kidnappers took care of her and provided medical treatment.

entry.title: Back in Pakistan, Nawaz Sharif gets bail in corruption cases
entry.summary: Pakistan's former prime minister, Nawaz Sharif, has been granted bail in corruption cases until October 26. Sharif, who was convicted on corruption charges in 2017, returned to Pakistan last week after four years in self-exile in London. The Islamabad High Court extended his protective bail after prosecutors from the anti-graft agency raised no objections. Sharif's convictions remain in force, but the court has barred authorities from arresting him until Tuesday, when he is due to appear in court. His legal team plans to pursue appeals against the convictions, with the aim of overturning them.

Finnish authorities raised a ship anchor on Tuesday from the seafloor in the area where an underwater gas pipeline was damaged earlier this month, saying a Hong Kong-flagged vessel appears to have caused the incident.Â The National Bureau of Investigation displayed pictures at a news conference of what it said was a 6-ton anchor that appears to be missing one of its arms, potentially belonging to the Hong Kong-flagged vessel â€œNewnew Polar Bear.â€Â An investigation is proceeding into whether the damage was intentional, officials told reporters in Vantaa, just outside of Helsinki.Â Read more ....Â Update #1: Finland Says Gas Pipeline Likely Broken by Ship Dragging Anchor (Reuters)Â Update #2: Finland Finds Anchor That Likely Damaged Gas Pipeline (AFP)Â WNU Editor: Sweden is making a different claim on one of its damaged cables .... entry.title: Turkish President ErdoÄŸan Finally Sends Swedenâ€™s NATO Bid To The Turkish Parliament
entry.summary:
Politico: ErdoÄŸan, at last, sends Swedenâ€™s NATO bid to Turkish parliament
Â Sweden welcomes the move, though the length of the Turkish approval process remains unclear.Â BRUSSELS â€” The Turkish government on Monday submitted Sweden's NATO accession bid to the country's parliament for ratification, ending a months-long guessing game over whether Ankara intended to postpone its approval process further. "The Protocol on Sweden's NATO Accession was signed by President Recep Tayyip ErdoÄŸan on October 23, 2023 and referred to the Grand National Assembly of Turkey," the presidency posted on social media platform X.Â Swedish Prime Minister Ulf Kristersson hailed the move. Welcome that President ErdoÄŸan signed Swedenâ€™s ratification protocol to NATO and submitted it to the Grand National Assembly of [Turkey]. Parliamentary procedures will now commence. We are looking forward to becoming a member of NATO," his office posted on the same platform.
Â Read more ....Â WNU Editor: Hungary is also a hold-out for Sweden to join NATO .... Hungary in the spotlight after Turkey presses on with Swedenâ€™s bid to join NATO (The Hill/AP).Â Turkish President ErdoÄŸan Finally Sends Swedenâ€™s NATO Bid To The Turkish Parliament
Â Turkeyâ€™s president submits protocol for Swedenâ€™s admission into NATO to parliament for ratification -- AP Â Sweden closer to NATO membership after Erdogan sends accession protocol to Turkish parliament -- CNN Â Turkeyâ€™s president submits bill to ratify Swedenâ€™s Nato membership -- The GuardianÂ Erdogan Finally Submits Sweden's NATO Bid To Turkish Parliament, With $20BN F-16 Deal Looming -- Zero Hedge

entry.title: We Are Now Living In A Multi-Polar World
entry.summary:
Moon Of Alabama: The Penny Drops - The World Is Multi-PolarÂ In 2007, during his famous speech in Munich, the Russian President Vladimir Putin pointed to the inevitable rise of a multipolar world.Â He started out by defining the opposite state:Â Â Â However, what is a unipolar world? However one might embellish this term, at the end of the day it refers to one type of situation, namely one centre of authority, one centre of force, one centre of decision-making.Â Â Â It is world in which there is one master, one sovereign. And at the end of the day this is pernicious not only for all those within this system, but also for the sovereign itself because it destroys itself from within.
Read more ....
Â WNU Editor: All that I can add to the above column is that I never expected this change to be happening as quickly as it is now.

entry.title: White House National Security Adviser Jake Sullivan Warns Israel-Gaza war "Could Spiral" Into A Bigger Conflict
entry.summary:
Cover illustration: Ricardo TomaÌs.Â Â Â
Axios: Top Biden official: Israel-Gaza war "could spiral" into bigger conflictÂ In a 7,000-word tour of the globe's future, White House national security adviser Jake Sullivan writes that amid Middle East peril, America needs a long-term "sustained sense of confidence in our capacity to outcompete any country."Â Driving the news: "In the decade ahead, U.S. officials will spend more time than they did the past 30 years talking with countries that they disagree with, often on fundamental issues," Sullivan writes in the cover story of the forthcoming issue of Foreign Affairs, shared first with Axios.Â Why it matters: "The world is becoming more contested, and the United States cannot talk only with those who share its vision or values," Sullivan writes.Â Â * "The coming era of competition will be unlike anything experienced before."
Â Read more ....
Â WNU Editor: White House National Security Adviser Jake Sullivan's column is here .... The Sources of American Power: A Foreign Policy for a Changed World (Jake Sullivan, Freign Affairs).

entry.title: UN agency says to halt Gaza work unless fuel arrives
entry.summary: The UN agency for Palestinian refugees, UNRWA, has warned that it may have to stop operations in the Gaza Strip unless urgent fuel deliveries are made. Aid agencies have expressed concern about the lack of fuel, which is necessary to power essential services such as hospitals. Six hospitals have already closed due to the fuel shortage, and the World Health Organization has stated that the limited supplies currently available will only last for a little over 24 hours.

entry.title: UN chief pleads for Gazans' safety, cites humanitarian law violations
entry.summary: UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres called for the protection of civilians in the conflict between Israel and Hamas. He expressed concerns about violations of international humanitarian law. Guterres also emphasized the importance of respecting and protecting civilians, while also acknowledging the grievances of the Palestinian people. Israel's UN Ambassador criticized Guterres' remarks, accusing him of having a sympathetic view towards terrorism.

entry.title: Worrying news for Indians in line for green card
entry.summary: The wait for permanent residency (green card) for Indians in the employment-based 2 and 3 categories in the US is getting longer. There are currently 1.1 million Indians in the queue for green cards, with most in the EB-2 and EB-3 categories. The US Citizenship and Immigration Services (USCIS) has announced that no more EB-2 or EB-3 I-485s from India will be accepted during fiscal year 2024 and beyond. This imbalance between supply and demand for green cards can only be addressed by Congress.

entry.title: Ukraine's Siberian Battalion recruits Russians to help fight Moscow
entry.summary: A group of 20 Russian citizens, dressed in Ukrainian uniforms, are training at a shooting range outside Kyiv to join Ukraine's newly-formed Siberian Battalion. A Ukrainian military officer, who asked to remain anonymous, said most of the unit's 50 members came from Russia, travelling through third countries to reach Ukraine. The officer said most are from among the indigenous peoples of Siberia and recruits said they want to fight against what they said was Russian imperialism.

entry.title: Turkish parliament commission set to study Swedish Nato bid
entry.summary: Turkey's parliament speaker will send a bill approving Sweden's Nato membership bid to the foreign affairs commission. President Tayyip Erdogan submitted the bill on Monday, which must now be approved by the commission before being ratified by the general assembly. The commission chair will decide when to discuss the bill. Hungary will also make a decision regarding the ratification of Sweden's Nato bid. Finland's membership was sealed in April 2023.

entry.title: Climate Change Turns African Rivers into Epicentres of Conflict
entry.summary:
NAIROBI, Oct 24 (IPS) - Almost all major river basins in Africa have become the epicentres for conflicts over the last 20 years, and agricultural yields on the continent could drop by up to 50 percent in the coming years owing to the drying up of 'traditional' water sources, thanks in part to effects climate change and degradation of the environment, the inaugural edition of the State of Africa's Environment Report 2023 released in Nairobi finds.

Read the full story, â€œClimate Change Turns African Rivers into Epicentres of Conflictâ€, on globalissues.org â†’

entry.title: Top Chinese Diplomat Visiting Washington Amid Tensions Between Beijing, DC
entry.summary:
Washington Post: Chinaâ€™s top diplomat to visit D.C. amid tensions over South China Sea, IsraelÂ Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi will visit Washington this week, the State Department said Monday, the highest-level visit by a Chinese official since tensions spiked early this year after a Chinese spy balloon floated across American airspace.Â The three days of meetings, starting Thursday, are the latest sign that Beijing is laying the groundwork for a possible visit by Chinese President Xi Jinping to a summit of Asia-Pacific leaders in San Francisco next month, which would be his first trip to the United States since 2017.Â Read more ....
Â WNU Editor: There is a summit of Asia-Pacific leaders in San Francisco next month, a summit that a Chinese leader would usually attend. But my gut is telling me that President Xi will not attend this summit even though the media is saying otherwise .... A top Chinese diplomat will visit Washington ahead of a possible meeting between Biden and Xi (AP). Current U.S. - China relations are in the toilet, and the leadership do not want to give any credit to the Biden administration, and they certainly do not want to meet President Biden.Â But in the event that President Xi does go to the US next month, I will see this as a signal that the Chinese are seeing the entire global order unraveling, and are making this trip as a last attempt to reverse this deterioration of global relations.Â Top Chinese Diplomat Visiting Washington Amid Tensions Between Beijing, DC
Â Secretary Blinken to Host Visit by Peopleâ€™s Republic of China (PRC) Director of the CCP Central Foreign Affairs Commission and Foreign Minister Wang Yi -- Secretary of State Â Chinaâ€™s top diplomat to visit Washington this week -- CNN Â Top Chinese diplomat visiting Washington amid tensions between Beijing, DC -- The Hill Â Chinaâ€™s Wang Yi to pay rare visit to US as two countries try to repair ties -- Al Jazeera

entry.summary: Around 100 people were arrested in Egypt for participating in pro-Palestinian demonstrations last week, although some have since been released. The protests, approved by the state, were held in various locations, but some protesters walked to Tahrir Square, which was not authorized for the demonstration. The unauthorized protesters were quickly dispersed by security personnel. Unapproved public protests are banned in Egypt, and Tahrir Square is heavily monitored due to its symbolic significance.

entry.title: Poll: Americans Overwhelmingly Back Giving Aid To Israel And Ukraine
entry.summary:
Photo Credit: Reuters
Â
USA Today: Poll: Americans overwhelmingly back aid to Israel and Ukraine but split on US role in the world
Â The debate over military aid and global leadership has opened a generation gap and a partisan divide, a new USA TODAY/Suffolk poll finds.Â Most Americans support sending additional military aid to Israel and Ukraine, a new USA TODAY/Suffolk University Poll finds, but a divide is deepening between those who see U.S. global leadership as crucial and those who want to pull back from the world to focus on problems at home instead.Â The survey found double-digit support for aid to Israel in its battle against the terrorist group Hamas, 58%-35%, and majority support for sending more aid to Ukraine in its war with Russia, 51%-43%.Â Additional military aid to Taiwan, which faces a continuing threat from China, was backed by a smaller margin, 43%-39%.Â The poll of 1,000 registered voters, taken Oct. 17-20 by landline and cell phone, has a margin of error of plus or minus 3.1 percentage points.Â Read more ....
Â WNU Editor: This explains why politically the White House sees their policy towards Ukraine and Israel as a winning one in the 2024 election cycle.

entry.title: House Republicans to pick third Speaker nominee in as many weeks
entry.summary: House Republicans are holding a fresh round of voting through secret ballots to select a candidate for the position of House Speaker, following the removal of Kevin McCarthy. Majority Leader Steve Scalise and House Judiciary Chairman Jim Jordan initially withdrew their candidacies due to insufficient support. Seven candidates are now in contention, including Jack Bergman, Byron Donalds, Tom Emmer, Mike Johnson, Kevin Hern, Austin Scott, and Pete Sessions. The selection process involves multiple rounds of voting, with the candidate receiving the fewest votes being eliminated in each round.

Kremlin spokesperson Dmitry Peskov also dismissed speculation that Putin has used body doubles to cover for him in public appearances.Â â€œTalk of Vladimir Putinâ€™s health problems is another canard,â€ Peskov said, according to Russian state-owned news agency Ria.ru, adding that â€œeverything is fine with him.â€

entry.title: Brazil: A Step Forward for Indigenous Peoples Rights
entry.summary:
MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Oct 24 (IPS) - Brazilâ€™s Supreme Court has delivered a long-awaited ruling upholding Brazilian Indigenous peoplesâ€™ claims to their traditional land. It did so by rejecting the â€˜Temporal Frameworkâ€™ principle, which only allowed for the demarcation and titling of lands physically occupied by the Indigenous groups who claimed them by 5 October 1988, when the current constitution was adopted. This excluded the numerous Indigenous communities whoâ€™d been violently expelled from their ancestral lands before then, including under military dictatorship between 1964 and 1985.

Read the full story, â€œBrazil: A Step Forward for Indigenous Peoples Rightsâ€, on globalissues.org â†’

entry.title: China Officially Removes Li Shangfu As Defence Minister After Two-Month Absence
entry.summary:

Li Shangfu, was at a forum for regional officials in Singapore, serving as the face of his countryâ€™s bold vision for reshaping Asiaâ€™s balance of power.Â He cast China as a force for stability and accused the United States of stirring trouble in the region, suggesting that its leaders should â€œmind your own business.â€Â Now, General Li has been dismissed after nearly two months out of public view â€” the latest example of Chinaâ€™s capricious rules of power under the strongman leader Xi Jinping.

entry.title: Gaza Authorities Say 700 Palestinians Have Been Killed In Overnight Israeli Airstrikes
entry.summary:
Reuters: Gaza authorities say 700 Palestinians killed in overnight strikes as Israel intensifies bombing campaignÂ GAZA/JERUSALEM (Reuters) - More than 700 Palestinians were killed in overnight Israeli air strikes, Gaza's health ministry said on Tuesday, the highest 24-hour death toll since Israel began a bombing campaign to crush Hamas militants who stunned the country with a deadly Oct. 7 attack.Â Israel said it had killed dozens of Hamas fighters in the overnight strikes on the besieged enclave but said its war to destroy the Islamist group would take time.Â As aid agencies warned that a humanitarian catastrophe was unfolding in Gaza, French President Emmanuel Macron flew to Israel to offer it support.
Â Read more ....
Â Update #1: Israel's increased strikes across Gaza kill more than 700 people in the past day, Palestinians say (AP) Â Update #2: Gaza officials say over 700 killed in a day (Al Jazeera)
Â WNU Editor: Considering the mayhem and destruction that is now happening in the Gaza strip my gut is telling me that no one really knows how many have died since the start of this war, let alone in the past 24 hours. entry.summary:

entry.title: White House Says Iran Is 'Facilitating' Attacks On US Middle East Troops
entry.summary:
Reuters: White House says Iran 'actively facilitating' some attacks on US military basesÂ WASHINGTON (Reuters) -The White House on Monday said Iran was in some cases "actively facilitating" rocket and drone attacks by Iranian-backed proxy groups on U.S. military bases in Iraq and Syria, and President Biden has directed the Department of Defense to brace for more and respond appropriately.Â White House spokesman John Kirby said there had been an uptick in such attacks over the last week, and especially over the last few days, but the U.S. would not allow its interests in the region to "go unchallenged."
Â Read more ....Â WNU Editor: At least the U.S. is not blaming Russia (for now).Â White House Says Iran Is 'Facilitating' Attacks On US Middle East Troops
Â US Vows to Hold Iran Responsible for Attacks on Troops in Mideast -- BloombergÂ Pentagon says it will hold Iran responsible for attacks on U.S. troops -- Politico Iran Is 'Facilitating' Attacks On US Middle East Troops: White House Aide -- Newsweek Â Iran â€˜Actively Facilitatingâ€™ Some Attacks on US Military Bases: White House says -- BNN

entry.title: Cow plague threatening ranches in southern Europe
entry.summary: Epizootic Hemorrhagic Disease, or EHD, is typically found in the tropics and affects cattle, deer and other animals. But due to abnormally high temperatures in Europe, cases are now spreading quickly across Spain, Italy and France. The virus causes internal bleeding, miscarriages and sterility. It's rarely fatal, but ranchers are concerned for their animals and livelihoods.

entry.title: Fifth death confirmed in UK after Storm Babet
entry.summary: A fifth death has been confirmed in the UK following the severe weather brought by Storm Babet. The body of a man was found after he went missing in flood waters in Aberdeenshire, Scotland. This brings the total number of deaths in Scotland to three, with two additional deaths in England. Thousands of homes have been flooded and several hundred people are homeless. The storm has also caused damage in Germany, Norway, and Denmark. The UK is still on alert with more heavy rain expected.

entry.title: 'Get this guy out of here!' Lindsey Graham blows up at Newsmax reporter in Israel
entry.summary:
During a press conference in Israel on Monday, Cohen noted that he was both an American and Israeli citizen. And he thanked Graham for supporting Israel. Graham is in Israel as part of a bipartisan US Senate delegation.
"But it starts at home," Cohen said. "And I'd like to ask any Democrat senator here that would like to speak to Rashida Tlaib. She still has a tweet up condemning Israel for a hospital attack." POLL: Should Trump be allowed to run for office?
"We are here together, not to talk about the problems at home, which are many," Graham shot back.
"You're not going to screw this up!" Graham shouted.
"Get this guy out of here!" Graham exclaimed.
"I'm an American," Graham said, pounding on the podium.
READ MORE: Trump's Georgia racketeering trial could happen 'sooner than he expected': Ex-prosecutor
"And I believe in free speech," Graham continued. "I don't believe what the squad has to say at all. But I came here with Democrats and Republicans to let everybody in the world know."
Graham later apologized after his temper cooled.

entry.summary:
Washington Post: Ukrainian spies with deep ties to CIA wage shadow war against RussiaÂ
KYIV â€” The cluttered car carrying a mother and her 12-year-old daughter seemed barely worth the attention of Russian security officials as it approached a border checkpoint.Â
But the least conspicuous piece of luggage â€” a crate for a cat â€” was part of an elaborate, lethal plot. Ukrainian operatives had installed a hidden compartment in the pet carrier, according to security officials with knowledge of the operation, and used it to conceal components of a bomb.Â
Four weeks later, the device detonated just outside Moscow in an SUV being driven by the daughter of a Russian nationalist who had urged his country to â€œkill, kill, killâ€ Ukrainians, an explosion signaling that the heart of Russia would not be spared the carnage of war.Â

entry.title: Swiss Right-Wing Populists Strengthen Hold After Federal Elections
entry.summary:
Politico: Swiss election results: Far right dominates after anti-immigration campaignÂ Final results show sizeble gains for the far-right Swiss Peopleâ€™s Party, and important losses for the Greens.Â The far-right and euroskeptic Swiss Peopleâ€™s Party (SVP) came out as a clear leader in Switzerlandâ€™s national elections, according to final results released late Sunday.Â The SVP, which has centered its campaign on anti-immigrant rhetoric in an election dominated by domestic issues, has won 28.6 percent of the vote in the Parliamentâ€™s lower chamber, the National Council â€” up from 25.6 percent four years ago â€” winning 62 seats, nine more than in 2019.Â While the centrist The Center party maintained its score at 14.6 percent (29 seats), the liberal FDP party suffered a small loss, losing one seat.
Â Read more ....Â Swiss Right-Wing Populists Strengthen Hold After Federal Elections

FOX News: Netanyahu says if Hezbollah launches a war against Israel and invades, 'it will make the mistake of its life'Â Israel is expected to launch a ground invasion into Gaza following Hamasâ€™ brutal Oct. 7 rampage into southern Israeli communities
Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu issued an open warning against Iran-backed terrorist group Hezbollah, which operates in Lebanon, discouraging them from invading Israel as his country is widely expected to launch a ground offensive in Gaza.Â The expected ground invasion follows Hamasâ€™ brutal Oct. 7 rampage into southern Israeli communities.
While visiting troops in northern Israel on Sunday, Netanyahu said if Hezbollah were to launch a war and invade Israel, "it will make the mistake of its life. We will cripple it with a force it cannot even imagine, and the consequences for it and the Lebanese state will be devastating."

entry.title: Erdogan submits Sweden's NATO bid to Turkish parliament
entry.summary: Turkey's President Recep Tayyip Erdogan has officially submitted Sweden's NATO membership application to parliament, bringing closer the end of a 17-month diplomatic standoff. Sweden dropped its policy of non-alignment last year after Russia's war on Ukraine, prompting its request for NATO membership. Hungary and Turkey are the only NATO members yet to ratify Sweden's membership. Erdogan agreed to put the ratification before the Turkish parliament at a NATO summit in July.

entry.title: Trump plots 'tremendously stupid' NATO plan for his second term: report
entry.summary: Former President Donald Trump is pushing for a major American foreign policy change in his second administration that would likely upend decades of global national security infrastructure. Sources tell Rolling Stone that Trump is planning to pull the United States entirely out of the North Atlantic Treaty Alliance unless it caves to his demands that include one that would seem to undermine the entire purpose of the alliance. In addition to his standard calls for other NATO countries to chip in more for their defense spending, Trump also reportedly wants to rip up the strategic doctrine that an attack on one NATO country represents an attack on all NATO countries. POLL: Should Trump be allowed to run for office? "When he was in office, Trump would repeatedly scoff at this collective-defense clause of the North Atlantic Treaty, known as Article 5," the publication writes. "One former senior administration official recalls to Rolling Stone a moment in the Oval Office in mid-2018 when the then-president started reading from a written list of smaller NATO countries, some of which he argued most Americans had never even heard of before." Tearing up Article 5 would be a major boon for the likes of Russia, which attacked non-NATO member Ukraine in 2022 but notably has not attacked other NATO members on its border such as Estonia and Latvia. Dr. Aaron Stein, a Black Sea Fellow at the Foreign Policy Research Institute, tells Rolling Stone that Trump's plan would be a "tremendously stupid endeavor" and added that "trading away allies based on ignorance, and Trump is ignorant about this issue, is just silly for broader U.S. national security."

entry.title: Book critical of Ming emperor recalled after prompting online comparisons with Xi
entry.summary: A book that drew comparisons between an inept Chinese emperor and President Xi Jinping has been pulled from shelves in China. The book, titled "Chongzhen: The Diligent Emperor of a Fallen Dynasty was recalled on October 16, due to "printing problems", its publisher, Dook Media Group, said in an online notice. Chongzhen, whose reign ended with his suicide in 1644, was noted by historians for his diligence as much as his paranoia, including the constant questioning of his subjects' loyalty.

entry.title: Argentina Presidential Election Heading To A Run-Off
entry.summary:
CNN: Argentina presidential election heading to run-off with Massa leading MileiÂ CNN â€” The battle to decide who will run crisis-wracked Argentina is heading to a run off vote next month between left wing candidate Sergio Massa and far right libertarian Javier Milei, according to data released by Argentinaâ€™s National Electoral Chamber after the first round of voting on Sunday. After polls closed Massa received the highest number of votes â€“ 8,877,325, accounting for 36.33% of the total, data revealed. Milei received 7,373,876 votes â€“ roughly 30.18%.
Third place candidate Patricia Bullrich got 23.82% and conceded defeat late Sunday night.Â Read more ....
Â WNU Editor: This result shows how powerful (and still popular) the Peronists are in Argentina.Â Argentina Presidential Election Heading To A Run-Off

entry.title: Web Summit chief resigns after Israel comments furor
entry.summary: The organiser of the Web Summit, one of the tech sector's leading events, announced his resignation Saturday following a backlash over his online posts following the Hamas attacks on Israel. "Unfortunately, my personal comments have become a distraction from the event," Paddy Cosgrave of Ireland explained in a brief statement sent to AFP. "I sincerely apologize again for any hurt I have caused," added the co-founder of the tech mega gathering created in 2009 in Dublin but held in Lisbon since 2016. A spokesperson for the organization said: "Web Summit will appoint a new CEO as soon as possible, and Web Summit 2023 in Lisbon will go ahead as planned." This year's edition from November 13 to 16, is set to bring together some 2,300 startups and more than 70,000 participants, say organizers. Several companies, including tech giants Google and Meta, which is behind Facebook and Instagram, as well as event headliners have announced they are boycotting the gathering since Cosgrave's remarks. He had written on X, formerly Twitter, that he was "shocked at the rhetoric and actions of so many Western leaders & governments" in support of Israel. "War crimes are war crimes even when committed by allies, and should be called out for what they are," he wrote on October 13. Since shock Hamas attacks on Israel on October 7, which left 1,400 dead, Israel has launched devastating air and ground bombardments of Gaza. The Hamas authorities say 4,385 people have died. The boycott by Meta and Google followed other exits by companies and tech figures, including Intel, Siemens and US comedian Amy Poehler and X-Files actor Gillian Anderson.

entry.title: Sunak nears first anniversary as UK PM with little to celebrate
entry.summary:
A first anniversary in office is normally a moment for a leader to celebrate, but Britain's Rishi Sunak hits the milestone this week with a mountain to climb to retain power in a general election expected next year.
Two by-election losses to the main opposition Labour Party on Thursday underscored how Sunak, 43, has failed to revive the Conservatives' beleaguered fortunes during his first 12 months in charge. "The more people see of Sunak, the less they like him in some ways," Tim Bale, author of a book about the right-wing Conservatives since Brexit, told AFP. "He doesn't really project authority, he doesn't necessarily give the impression that he's in control of events. "He looks, in part, as if he's sort of lurching from one policy initiative to another in a desperate attempt to curry â€¦

entry.title: U.S. President Biden: "I Am A Zionist"
entry.summary:
Reuters: 'I am a Zionist': How Joe Biden's lifelong bond with Israel shapes war policyÂ
WASHINGTON (Reuters) - When Joe Biden met with Prime Minister Netanyahu and his war cabinet during his visit to Israel, the U.S. president assured them: "I don't believe you have to be a Jew to be a Zionist, and I am a Zionist."Â The politicians and generals gathered in the ballroom of the Tel Aviv hotel nodded in approval, according to a U.S. official knowledgeable of the closed-door remarks, even as Israel bombarded Gaza in retaliation for a devastating attack by Palestinian Hamas militants and with a ground invasion looming.Â Biden, who is of Irish Catholic descent, has used similar words in the past to profess his affinity for Israel. But the moment, which has not been previously reported, illustrates how Biden's decades as one of the leading "Friends of Israel" in American politics seem to be guiding him during a defining crisis of his presidency.
Â Read more ....
Â WNU Editor:Â I guess this explains why many American Muslims are deserting the US President .... â€˜The man broke my heartâ€™: Bidenâ€™s Arab-American boosters begin to leave his side (Politico).

entry.title: Indigenous Australians denounce 'shameful' referendum result
entry.summary: Aboriginal Australian leaders ended their vow of silence on Monday to denounce millions of their compatriots for rejecting a landmark push for Indigenous rights, saying that the referendum result would be "etched into Australia's history forever". Simmering racial divisions were exposed earlier this month when just over 60 percent of Australians voted against a referendum to acknowledge Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders within the 1901 constitution. In the wake of the result, many Indigenous leaders embarked on a "week of silence", asking for time to grieve what they saw as a crushing rejection at the hands of Australia's white majority. Some leaders ended that silence in a scathing open letter addressed to the government, criticizing the "appalling and mean-spirited" outlook of milliâ€¦

A teenage Iranian girl, who fell into a coma earlier this month following an alleged encounter with officers over violating the countryâ€™s hijab law, is said to be "brain dead", Iranian state media reported on Sunday. "Follow-ups on the latest health condition of Armita Geravand indicate that her health condition as brain dead seems certain despite the efforts of the medical staff," the Islamic Republic of Iran News Network said. Iranian authorities have denied claims by rights groups that the 16-year-old was hurt after a confrontation on Oct. 1 with officers enforcing the mandatory Islamic dress code in the Tehran metro.
The report on Geravand could revive nationwide protests sparked by the death of 22-year-old Kurdish Iranian woman Mahsa Amini last year in the custody of morality police. (Reuters)

entry.title: Hurricane Norma makes landfall in Mexico as Category 1 storm
entry.summary: Hurricane Norma slammed into Mexico's northwestern coast Saturday afternoon as a Category 1 storm, bringing dangerous rain and flooding, authorities said. The storm came ashore about 25 kilometers (15 miles) northwest of the resort city of Cabo San Lucas on the Baja California coast, gradually weakening from a Category 3 as it approached land. Norma was moving northeast at 9 kph, packing winds of up to 130 kph, the National Hurricane Center (NHC) reported at 2100 GMT. Norma was expected to bring rainfall of up to 45 centimeters (18 inches), producing "flash and urban flooding, along with mudslides in areas of higher terrain," the NHC said. "Life-threatening surf and rip current conditions" would affect the coast of southwestern and west-central Mexico and Baja California Sur for the next couple of days. Hotel employees in Cabo San Lucas urged guests to stay indoors until authorities give the all-clear, Gustavo Matamoros, a hotel worker, told AFP. Local authorities say about 60,000 tourists are staying in the area, most of them international visitors. Footage from Milenio TV showed flooded streets as Norma arrived. No casualties have been reported by authorities. Norma should continue to weaken to a tropical storm as it moves toward the west coast of Mexico on Sunday. Two people died last week when Hurricane Lidia struck the western states of Jalisco and Nayarit. Â© Agence France-Presse

entry.title: US Senate Minority Leader Mitch McConnell Calls China, Russia, And Iran The New 'Axis Of Evil' That The US Must Deal With
entry.summary:
McConnell calls China, Russia, Iran new 'axis of evil' that US must deal with: 'This is an emergency' https://t.co/KwbAwSd2Cg â€” Fox News (@FoxNews) October 22, 2023
FOX News: McConnell calls China, Russia, Iran new 'axis of evil' that US must deal with: 'This is an emergency'Â Senate Minority Leader Mitch McConnell says Israel-Hamas war is a 'worldwide problem' posing 'immediate threat' to US
Senate Minority Leader Mitch McConnell, R-Ky., on Sunday deemed China, Russia and Iran the new "axis of evil" amid wars in Ukraine and Israel, while addressing U.S. funding of allies' responses to those duel conflicts.Â In a new sit-down interview with "Fox News Sunday" host Shannon Bream, McConnell, the highest-ranking Senate Republican, agreed with fellow Republican Kentuckian Sen. Rand Paul that the $1.5 trillion deficit is "entirely too big."Â But while Paul remarked last month that the U.S. under the Biden administration was borrowing heavily from China just to send aid to Ukraine, McConnell instead emphasized Sunday that the deficit also expanded during the prior administration under former President Donald Trump.

entry.title: Iran jails 2 journalists who covered hijab death row, for 'collaborating with US'
entry.summary: Two journalists in Iran have been sentenced to up to seven years in prison for collaborating with the US government and other charges. Niloufar Hamedi and Elaheh Mohammadi were imprisoned for over a year following their coverage of Mahsa Amini's death in police custody. The New York-based Committee to Protect Journalists has condemned the decision and called for their release. The journalists were charged with collaborating with the US government, colluding against national security, and propaganda against the system. Their detentions have sparked international criticism over the security force crackdown after Amini's death.

entry.title: Israel 'accidentally' fires at Egyptian post; 2nd aid convoy on way to Gaza
entry.summary: A second aid convoy entered the Egyptian side of the Rafah border crossing on Sunday, heading towards Gaza. Shortly after the convoy entered, a blast was heard and seven people were wounded. The Israeli military said one of its tanks accidentally fired and hit an Egyptian position near the border. The Egyptian military said the blast caused minor injuries and that an investigation is underway. The convoy carried medical and food supplies, and distribution of the supplies began on Sunday. However, aid officials are warning of a humanitarian disaster as supplies run low.

entry.summary: BUENOS AIRES (Reuters) â€” Argentina's general election vote was being counted on Sunday evening, with early signals suggesting the under-fire Peronist ruling coalition was performing better than expected, while all eyes remained on far-right libertarian radical Javier Milei. Argentines flocked to the polls on Sunday to vote in a tense national election where wild-haired outsider Milei has hogged the limelight amid the country's worst economic crisis in two decades and rising anger with the traditional elite.

entry.title: Antisemitism, Islamophobia on rise in West
entry.summary: Advocacy groups have reported a significant increase in antisemitic and Islamophobic incidents in the US and Europe since the recent Hamas attacks in Israel. The Anti-Defamation League recorded a 55% rise in antisemitic incidents in the US compared to the same period last year. There have also been spikes in anti-Israel rallies and antisemitic harassment on messaging apps. Similarly, the Council on American-Islamic Relations reported an increase in anti-Muslim incidents in the past week. In the UK, anti-Muslim attacks have increased sixfold, while France and Germany have also seen a rise in antisemitic incidents.

entry.title: How diplomacy helped set free mom-daughter
entry.summary: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken spoke with Qatar's PM about the issue of the hostages held by Hamas during the recent attack on Israel. Qatar played a significant role in delicate talks involving multiple countries to secure the release of the captives. When Hamas released two captives, the Raanan family, US officials thanked Qatar for their involvement. Families of the remaining hostages hope this is just the beginning. The hostages have likely been split into small groups, and it is unclear why the Raanans were released first, although their American nationality may have played a role.

entry.title: Israel strikes a 'terror compound' in West Bank
entry.summary: The Israeli military conducted an airstrike on a mosque in the occupied West Bank, resulting in the death of at least two people. The strike targeted an underground compound allegedly being used by Hamas and Islamic Jihad for organizing an imminent attack. The Palestinian foreign ministry condemned the airstrike as a "dangerous escalation" and accused Israel of using tactics from the Gaza Strip in the West Bank. Violence in the area has increased following recent attacks by Hamas.

entry.title: Pentagon sees threat to US troops in West Asia, beefs up military assets
entry.summary: US officials, including Secretary of State Antony Blinken and Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin, have expressed concerns about the potential escalation of attacks on US troops in the West Asia region. They also mentioned the possibility of Iran trying to expand the Israel-Hamas conflict. The US has recently deployed additional military assets to the region, including a Thaad battery and extra Patriot battalions, to prevent the conflict from spreading. The US has already sent significant naval power and has troops stationed in Iraq and Syria.

entry.summary: The Israel-Hamas conflict has raised concerns about a wider conflict in the region. Israel has continued to bombard Gaza, with the death toll rising. Clashes between Hezbollah and Israeli forces along the Lebanon border have also escalated. Israeli missiles have hit airports in Syria, where Iran has a military presence. Israel has warned of a potential ground offensive in Gaza, while also evacuating communities close to the Lebanon border. The situation remains tense, with fears of further escalation.

He expressed pride that Netaji had chosen Malaysia as a base to organize Indians against British colonial rule. In Bangkok, the Netaji Subhash Vision Thailand organization celebrated the anniversary with a 3-day "Netaji Pilgrimage" for academics and Indo-Thai citizens connected to Bose's historical visits to Thailand. The first-ever INA training camp was built in Chonburi, Thailand, where Indian migrant families supported Netaji's cause.

entry.summary: China is constructing the world's largest underwater microscope, the Tropical Deep-sea Neutrino Telescope (TRIDENT), to hunt for elusive neutrinos or "ghost particles" in the Western Pacific Ocean. Set to be completed in 2030, TRIDENT aims to capture neutrinos as they become detectable in the deep ocean depths, providing insights into their cosmic origins.

entry.title: Pulitzer winner's New York talk cancelled over Gaza stand

The organization, 92nd Street Y, postponed the event without giving a reason or offering an alternative date. The organization cited Nguyen's stance on Israel and the recent attack by Hamas as reasons for the postponement. Nguyen's representatives have not commented on the cancellation.

entry.title: Trump told a friend the 'perfect' Ukraine call was 'nothing compared to what I usually do'
entry.summary:
A secret recording revealed by "60 Minutes Australia" exposed a conversation former President Donald Trump had with billionaire Anthony Pratt while he was in office, The New York Times reported. Pratt is the businessman whom the ex-president told classified secrets that are of the highest possible security level. Another thing Trump revealed is a detail from the call he had with Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelensky in late 2019 that ultimately led to his first impeachment. Among the notes of the call, Trump told Zelensky that he would release the military equipment already allocated by Congress if and only if he did a "favor" for him.
Declassified text of Trump's Ukraine call notes
Photo: Scren capture
Trump bragged to Pratt: â€œThat was nothing compared to what I usually do," admitting not only to the bribery but also that it's frequent behavior for him.
"It is not clear whether Mr. Pratt shared these accounts with prosecutors or whether prosecutors are aware of the recordings," The Times reported. Another thing included in the report is that Trump asked his wife Melania to strut about Mar-a-Lago in a bikini. Another revelation is that behind closed doors Pratt was trashing Trump, even while he was still in office. Senate Republicans ultimately refused to hear beyond the opening statements of the Trump impeachment, voting to acquit him of the charges. Read the full report here.

entry.title: Israel Is Now Fighting On 3 Fronts
entry.summary:
Insider: Israel is now fighting on 3 fronts as airstrikes and violence escalate across the Palestinian territories, Lebanon, and SyriaÂ Â * Israel is now waging war on three fronts â€” the Palestinian territories, Lebanon, and Syria.Â Â * As the conflict spreads, the US is beefing up its military presence in the region.Â Â * US Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin said it was in response to "recent escalations by Iran and its proxy forces."Â Following the Palestinian militant group Hamas' attacks on Israel on October 7, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu declared war on the group.Â Now, that conflict is spilling over into the neighboring countries of Lebanon and Syria as Israel ramps up airstrikes on the two Arab states.Â The US has sent more military assets to the region to bolster Israel's forces following what US Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin called "recent escalations by Iran and its proxy forces."
Â Read more ....
Â WNU Editor: The Israeli - Hamas war will play itself out, but it is Hezbollah in southern Lebanon who I would be concerned about.

entry.title: Pangea Ultima: The uninhabitable supercontinent of Earth's distant future
entry.summary: Scientists at the University of Bristol have used supercomputer climate models to predict the formation of a future supercontinent called Pangea Ultima, which is expected to occur 250 million years from now. This continent will bring extreme temperatures, rendering it uninhabitable for mammals. The study attributes the dramatic increase in temperatures to heightened volcanism and the sun emitting more energy and heat as it ages. The research provides insights into how Earth's climate might change in the distant future due to natural processes. Despite concerns about contemporary climate change, the Earth is expected to remain habitable until the emergence of Pangea Ultima.

entry.title: Geological time capsules: Diamonds tell the tale of Earth's ancient continents
entry.summary: An international team of experts has analyzed ancient superdeep diamonds found in mines in Brazil and Western Africa to gain new insights into the early evolution of complex life on Earth. These rare diamonds, formed within the supercontinent Gondwana, provide information about the formation and movement of supercontinents. The research reveals that supercontinents played a role in concentrating deep oceanic plate subduction. The diamonds formed deep beneath Gondwana and were carried to the surface during volcanic eruptions.

entry.title: Secretary of State Antony Blinken says "we'll be prepared" if Iran escalates attacks
entry.summary: Secretary of State Antony Blinken tells "Face the Nation" that the U.S. is "concerned at the possibility of Iranian proxies, escalating their attacks against our own personnel, our own people. We're taking every measure to make sure that we can defend them and if necessary, respond decisively. Not at all what we're looking for, not all we want, but we'll be prepared, if that's what they choose to do."

entry.title: U.S. Accuses China's Military Of Coercive And Risky Behaviors In The Indo-Pacific Region
entry.summary:
VOA: US Sees 'Sharp Increase' in Chinese Military's Coercive, Risky BehaviorsÂ WASHINGTON â€” As the U.S. Defense Department prepares to release its annual China Military Power report (CMPR), officials said the Chinese military has been engaged in "a centralized and concerted campaign" to perform risky behaviors in the Indo-Pacific region to "coerce a change" in operational activities by the U.S. and its allies.Â Meanwhile, Washington has renewed its call for military-to-military communication with China to prevent inadvertent conflicts. Senior defense officials from the two countries are expected to join their counterparts from the Association of Southeast Asian Nations for meetings in mid-November in Jakarta, Indonesia.
Â Read more ....
Â WNU Editor: China has responded by releasing their own video of provocative maneuvers from the US military in the South China Sea (see video below).

entry.title: 'Beyond the pale': ABC host hits Tim Scott for saying Biden has 'blood on his hands'
entry.summary:
While appearing on ABC's This Week, host Jonathan Karl pressed Scott on his claim that U.S. "weakness" led to the terrorist attacks.
POLL: Should Trump be allowed to run for office?be allowed to run for office?
The candidate pointed to the Biden administration's decision to release $6 billion in Iranian funds.
But Scott also acknowledged that Iran never received any of the money because the Biden administration froze it.
"And to say that Joe Biden is complicit, which you also said, in the greatest, deadliest attack on the Jewish people since the Holocaust, I mean, that's beyond the pale, isn't it?" the ABC host asked.
"There's no doubt that when you have President Biden negotiating with the Iranians for the release of hostages, I said this under President Obama as well, when we paid 400 million dollars for hostages, you were creating a market for American lives to be lost," Scott opined.
Watch the video below from ABC or at the link. .

entry.title: Chinese Coast Guard Ship Deliberately Collides With Philippine Supply Vessel In South China Sea
entry.summary:
CNN: China and Philippines accuse each other over collisions in disputed South China Sea Â China and the Philippines on Sunday accused each other of causing collisions in a disputed area of the South China Sea, the latest in a string of maritime confrontations between the two countries that have heightened regional tensions.Â In a statement, Philippine authorities said a Chinese Coast Guard ship carried out â€œdangerous blocking maneuversâ€ that caused it to collide with a Philippine vessel carrying supplies to troops stationed in Ayungin Shoal, also known as Second Thomas Shoal, in the Spratly Islands chain.Â Chinaâ€™s move was â€œprovocative, irresponsible and illegalâ€ and â€œimperiled the safety of the crewâ€ of the Philippine boats, the National Task Force for the West Philippine Sea said.
Â Read more ....Â WNU Editor: It is a ticking time bomb .... South China Sea a ticking time bomb waiting to explode (Asia Times).Â Chinese Coast Guard Ship Deliberately Collides With Philippine Supply Vessel In South China SeaÂ Â Philippines says a coast guard ship and supply boat were rammed by Chinese vessels at disputed shoal -- APÂ China, Philippines trade accusations over South China Sea clash -- Reuters Â Philippines says coast guard ship and supply boat were hit by Chinese vessels in South China Sea -- ABC News Australia Â Philippines, China trade blame over collisions in contested South China Sea -- Al Jazeera Â China Coast Guard Vessel Collides with Filipino Supply Ship in South China Sea -- USNI News

Israel has pounded the Hamas-run Gaza Strip with airstrikes after the October 7 massacres in southern Israeli border towns. entry.title: Heavy rains cause partial dam collapse, flooding in Norway
entry.summary: Storm Hans battered Norway with heavy rains Tuesday and Wednesday. Flooding of the Braskereidfoss power dam control room prevented the hatches from opening, causing a partial collapse and flooding downriver. The heavy rains provoked mudslides and swollen rivers which swept away some structures and flooded towns, requiring the evacuation of more than 3,000 people and isolating others.

entry.title: Who is responsible for Turkeyâ€™s bad buildings?
entry.summary:
Buildings destroyed after the earthquake on February 13, 2023, in Hatay, Turkey. | Murat Saka/dia images via Getty Images
Turkey is investigating and has arrested some contractors, but the entire political and economic system is implicated. Turkey is still in the middle of an emergency, reeling from the earthquake that killed at least 35,000 people last week. But the finger-pointing has already begun. The rush to punishment comes amid the grief, but also the mounting fury and frustration over the Turkish governmentâ€™s earthquake response. Much of that is focused on the emergency response â€” waiting for aid and rescue teams â€” but it is also extending to anger about policies before the earthquake, about how shoddy building construction may have exacerbated the devastation of the disâ€¦

entry.title: 10 years ago, we were turning nuclear bombs into nuclear energy. We can do it again.
entry.summary:
Getty Images
How we turned 20,000 Soviet nukes into zero-carbon energy â€” and how we can do the same with some of our own. Just a decade ago, one in 10 American lightbulbs was powered by dismantled Russian nuclear weapons. That was made possible by the Megatons to Megawatts program, an agreement negotiated after the collapse of the Soviet Union to convert uranium from Russiaâ€™s nuclear weapons stockpile into fuel for US nuclear power plants. The unconventional policy was first proposed by MIT physicist Thomas Neff in a 1991 New York Times op-ed. By the time Megatons to Megawatts ran its full course from 1993 to 2013, it had eliminated about 20,000 nuclear warheads and stood out as a point of shared pride in the often jaded arms control and disarmament field. â€œNearly every commerciaâ€¦

entry.title: Why earthquakes are deadlier depending on where you live
entry.summary:
Volunteers stand on rubble of a destroyed building in Kahramanmaras, Turkey, on February 7, 2023. | Adem Altan/AFP via Getty Images
What Turkey and Syriaâ€™s deadly earthquakes reveal about wealth. In the early hours of Monday, February 6, residents living in southern Turkey and northern Syria were woken by violent shaking, collapsing buildings, and sweeping blackouts. The earthquake buried residents in rubble and was followed by powerful aftershocks. By the following Monday, the death toll had passed 36,000 people. â€œIt was like the apocalypse,â€ Abdul Salam al-Mahmoud, a resident of Atareb, Syria, told Reuters. The country is no stranger to quakes, having lost 17,000 people to a 7.4-magnitude tremor in 1999. But while last weekâ€™s earthquake was a 7.8-magnitude quake, and had an uâ€¦

A suspected Chinese spy balloon flies above Charlotte, North Carolina, on February 4, 2023.Â | Peter Zay/Anadolu Agency via Getty Images
